content: sewing all the way around the edge fig 38 through 40 connectors - you can use these with your legs or antennae depending on the look you are trying to achieve if you are using connectors you must attach them before attaching the whole leg/antenna to the body to attach to leg/antenna fold connector in half sandwiching the limb inside chain 4 should be towards the limb and the increases at the base of the limb fig 41 using the chain 4 tail sew the limb to the chain 4 creating 2 stitches on each side of the limb tie to the tail from the increases fig 42 use longer tail for attaching to the body 15 © emma scanga 2020 assembly continued legs- i highly suggest looking at your preferred bug for reference on leg placement some legs will be horizontal and others vertical mine were as follows beetle horizontal- front legs towards the head the middle and back two legs towards the back fig 43 bumble front two legs were horizontal facing forward middle legs vertical slightly turned back back legs vertical turned backward fig 43 pill bug all vertical front legs turned forward the rest of the legs vertical and slightly under body fig 43 spider all legs horizontal and placed in the middle segment 2 sets forward 2 sets back fig 43 to attach after deciding placement and direction use one tail and insert into the body exit where the other tail is located at least one stitch in between tie ends together and hide antennae - using your reference photos as a guide place your antenna on the head shell - these will be placed on the largest portion of the body the beginning chain 19 will be in the center you re stitch marker will run along round 18 or round 19 of the body note- one shell you ll have to push the round part of the shell to the other direction the last row will be on the outsides i prefer to use a running stitch to attach the shells along round 19 and if necessary tack the tips of the shell to secure in place fig 44 16 © emma scanga 2020 assembly continued wings- i use vinyl and a marker to create the detail in the wings if my vinyl is too thin i ll double up the vinyl and glue the pieces together these are then sewn onto the thorax middle section of the body you can also use felt if that is easier fig 45 horns- these can go wherever you bug has them placed… whether that is directly on top of the head on the thorax or more towards the front of the head mine i folded in half and attached on the head over the eyes fig 46 pouch- this is more a method than an a pattern i ll share the number of stitches i used but you can easily make the pouch as big
